article:
In mathematics, a 'subsequential limit' of a sequence is the limit of some
subsequence. Every subsequential limit is a cluster point, but not conversely.
In first-countable spaces, the two concepts coincide.

The supremum of the set of all subsequential limits of some sequence is called
the limit superior, or limsup. Similarly, the infimum of such a set is called
the limit inferior, or liminf. See limit superior and limit inferior.

If (X,d) is a metric space and there is a Cauchy sequence such that there is a
subsequence converging to some x, then the sequence also converges to x.
